page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: {Kelty.} North edge of Fife coalfield 2M/3K North of Cowdenbeath. Kelty is a village with a population of just over 5,000. The highest point in this sector is some 210ms. Kelty was, formerly, a mining village but the industry is now defunct. The village of Kelty is built on the side of a hill with an Easterly aspect. One quarter of the sector is utilised by forest, one half by farmland, and the remainder by the village and other settlement, including some by water. To the East is a newly created Country Park called{The Meadows}which was formerly a "derelict mining area". There are four farms in the sector.
